intro: Anthistiria imberbis var. burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. It has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and localized species.
